data.profileText: a Representative from Georgia; born in Frederick, Frederick County, Md., December 15, 1786; in childhood moved with his parents to Georgia; completed preparatory studies; attended the local academies in Louisville and Augusta, Ga.; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Augusta, Ga., in 1812; served as judge of the superior court 1825-1828; member of the State house of representatives in 1830; elected as a Jacksonian candidate to the Twenty-third and to the succeeding Congress, but resigned on July 1, 1835, before the convening of the Twenty-fourth Congress, having been nominated for Governor (March 4, 1833-July 1, 1835); Governor of Georgia 1835-1837; president of the Georgia Medical College at Augusta; died near Augusta, Ga., November 20, 1858; interment in the family burying ground at Richmond Hill, near Augusta, Ga.

researchRecord.name: July 2, 1836. 1 letter.
researchRecord.description: Official correspondence. Finding aid in repository.

researchRecord.name: 1836, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from John W.A. Sanford to William Schley written on September 8, 1836. In the letter, Sanford writes at the close of the Creek War, and mentions the service of Gen. Winfield Scott.

In the Thomas Sidney Jesup Papers, 1787-1860, 101 items.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1826-1898, 0.25 linear foot.
researchRecord.description: This collection consists of papers relating to William Schley from 1826-1840. The papers include three letters, a brief biographical sketch, and one document, A Governor's Address to the Georgia Assembly, November 7, 1837. A finding aid is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Tomlinson Fort Family Papers, 1808-1882, approximately 600 items.
In File II Names.
researchRecord.description: File is primarily incoming correspondence to the Governor of Georgia. Finding aid in repository.
